business.headline: Booking plans job cuts as part of company's reorganisation planBooking Holdings, which owns brands like Booking.com and Kayak, did not disclose how many jobs would be affected but said it expected to provide more details on timing, likely impact on employees and financials "in due course".

Elon Musk's Tesla hits $1 trillion market value after Trump winThe electric automaker's shares jumped 8.2 per cent to $321.22, catapulting the company's valuation above the trillion-dollar mark for the first time in more than two years.

A woman's soulmate is another woman: Kalli Purie at Business Today MPW 2024Kalli Purie, Vice-Chairperson and Executive Editor-in-Chief, India Today Group, delivered the vote of thanks at Business Today's Most Powerful Women 2024 awards.

Watch: Trailblazers awarded at Business Today's Most Powerful Women 2024Business Today unveiled the 21st edition of its Most Powerful Women in Business list on Friday, celebrating 60 exceptional women leaders who are pioneering change, driving growth, and inspiring progress across diverse industries. This year's edition brings in 12 fresh faces and recognises four returning achievers, underscoring the dynamic nature of leadership in business. Watch the award ceremony here on India Today.

I salute the trailblazers: Kalli Purie at Business Today's Most Powerful Women eventKalli Purie, Vice-Chairperson and Executive Editor-in-Chief, India Today Group, lauded the growing accomplishments and transformation of women leaders in India.

Trailblazers on Business Today's Most Powerful Women 2024 listThis year's Business Today Most Powerful Women list introduces 12 new faces, four returning achievers, and 37 repeat honourees from last year. Two trailblazers entered the MPW Hall of Fame after seven-time wins.

Americans can learn a lesson or two from India: Piyush Goyal on women representationUnion Minister of Commerce & Industry Piyush Goyal lauded India's approach to women's empowerment and said that Americans can learn a lesson or two from India on women representation.

Harley-Davidson tariffs to be cut after Trump's return? Piyush Goyal respondsSpeaking at the Business Today's Most Powerful Women 2024 event, Piyush Goyal expressed India's openness to reconsidering the tariffs on the iconic motorcycles.

Women leaders share insights on achieving work-life balance and success at BT MPW 2024At the Business Today MPW 2024 session, Ritu Arora, CEO & CIO of Allianz Investment Management, Asia Pacific, Nirupa Shankar, Joint MD of Brigade Group; and Devita Saraf, Chairperson & CEO of Vu Group, shared insights on striking a fine balance between work, life, health and wealth.

Women need to move from being savers to investors: Radhika GuptaSpeaking at the Business Today Most Powerful Women 2024 event, Radhika Gupta, MD and CEO of Edelweiss Mutual Fund, emphasised the need for women to move beyond saving and start investing.

It's not complicated: Radhika Gupta urges women to manage their own moneySpeaking at Business Today's Most Powerful Women 2024 event, Edelweiss Mutual Fund Managing Director and CEO Radhika Gupta said that while women have been the "chief financial officers" of their households for generations, it's time to extend that role into the financial markets.

Women have always had a tough time breaking barriers in business: Padmaja Ruparel at BT MPW 2024Speaking at Business Today's Most Powerful Women 2024 event, Padmaja Ruparel said women always had a tough time breaking barriers in business.

Zomato, Swiggy accused of unfair practices in food delivery market: ReportThe investigation found these companies implemented practices that gave preferential treatment to certain restaurants on their platforms.
Sensex, Nifty end in red as FII selling offsets IT gains; RVNL tanks 6%The S&P BSE Sensex dropped 55.47 points to settle at 79,486.32, while the NSE Nifty50 fell 89.95 points to 24,109.40.

Shiv Nadar, billionaire with a big heart, donates Rs 2,153 crore in FY24For the third time in five years, Shiv Nadar and his family have topped the EdelGive-Hurun India Philanthropy List 2024, contributing Rs 2,153 crore in the fiscal year 2024.

Sharan Hegde of 1% Club faces criticism after laying off 15% employeesPopular finfluencer Sharan Hegde is facing backlash after announcing layoffs at his company, 1% Club. His LinkedIn post has drawn criticism from many on social media.

Indian Hotels share price jumps over 6% to hit 1-year high. Buy, hold or sell?Indian Hotels share price: After a softer June quarter, the Tata group's hospitality arm showed strong recovery, buoyed by wedding-driven demand in Mumbai and pent-up bookings delayed by Q1's election and weather impacts.

Reliance Power share price hits 5% lower circuit after major setback. Details hereReliance Power shares have faced significant volatility this year. The stock has surged by 103% over the past year, reaching a 52-week high of Rs 54.25 in early October.

Trent share price continues to fall. Should you buy, sell or hold? At 11:24 am, Trent's share price was down 2.69% to Rs 6,323.55 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE). In the previous session, Trent shares fell 8%.

Explained: Why Ircon International share price slipped 5% after Q2 resultsFor the July-September quarter, Ircon reported a standalone net profit of Rs 202.22 crore, down 12.2% year-on-year (YoY). Revenue from operations also saw a steep fall, dropping 20.3% YoY to Rs 2,298.86 crore.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: Khalistanis present in Canada, admits Trudeau, says not all Hindus Modi backersAmid the ongoing diplomatic row between India and Canada, Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau accepted the presence of Khalistani supporters on Canadian soil, adding that they do not represent the Sikh community as a whole in the country.

Elon Musk joins Trump's call with Zelenskyy amid White House role buzz: ReportElon Musk was with Trump during the 25-minute call with Zelenskyy. During the conversation, Zelenskyy congratulated Trump for his decisive victory in the US presidential elections this week.

Pak PM congratulates Trump, gets community noted for using X that he bannedPakistan's Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif congratulated Donald Trump using X, faced criticism for using the platform after banning it.

Ex-Himachal Chief Minister hosts samosa party to mock Sukhvinder SukhuFormer Himachal Pradesh Chief Minister Jairam Thakur organised a samosa party with BJP workers to mock the Congress over a controversy over a 'CID probe into missing samosas' intended for Sukhvinder Sukhu.
Couldn't save samosas, yeh kya samvidhan bachayenge?Can the lords and saviours of the nation protect the Constitution if these saviours can't even save our savouries?

A woman's soulmate is another woman: Kalli Purie at Business Today MPW 2024Kalli Purie, Vice-Chairperson and Executive Editor-in-Chief, India Today Group, delivered the vote of thanks at Business Today's Most Powerful Women 2024 awards.

Tortured by Army officer, wanted to become a militant: New J&K MLA's revelationNational Conference MLA Qaiser Jamshaid Lone said that during his younger years, he wanted to become a militant after he was "tortured and humiliated" by an Army officer during a military crackdown.

Rs 3.7 crore cash seized from van in Palghar amid Maharashtra poll codeAmid the ongoing poll code ahead of the Maharashtra Assembly elections on November 20, police in Palghar district of the state have seized over Rs 3.70 crore in cash from a van on Thursday.

BTS video shows how Trump comes up with his social media postsThe video shows Donald Trump composing his social media posts in real time while hearing a speech of Kamala Harris as his aide types it out at breakneck speed.

Hansal Mehta addresses criticism of The Buckingham Murders Hindi dubHansal Mehta addressed criticism over the Hindi dubbed version of his film, The Buckingham Murders, starring Kareena Kapoor Khan. The filmmaker responded to an X user about the same and clarified the situation.

100 ACs, 76 Bose speakers, jacuzzis: BJP gives peek into opulent Chief Minister houseA video posted on X by BJP's IT Cell chief Amit Malviya lists the range of opulent items found at the Delhi Chief Minister's residence. It was vacated by Arvind Kejriwal after he stepped down as Chief Minister in October.

Three coaches of Secunderabad-Shalimar Express derail in Bengal's NalpurOne parcel van and two coaches of the Secunderabad-Shalimar Superfast Express derailed while passing Nalpur station in West Bengal's Kharagpur Division early on Saturday morning, the Railways said.
Is the new trend electrolysis better for hair removal than laser?Electrolysis is a hair removal technique that permanently removes unwanted hair by targeting each hair follicle individually.

Harley-Davidson tariffs to be cut after Trump's return? Piyush Goyal respondsSpeaking at the Business Today's Most Powerful Women 2024 event, Piyush Goyal expressed India's openness to reconsidering the tariffs on the iconic motorcycles.

1st T20I: Samson 107, Varun magic inspire India's Durban demolition jobSouth Africa vs India: A terrific hundred from Sanju Samson and a superb middle-overs block from Varun Chakravarthy guided India to a commanding win against South Africa in Durban. The Suryakumar Yadav-led team won the first T20I by 61 runs to take 1-0 lead in the series.

Indians stuffed in train toilets, China moves billions with little fussMillions of travellers get added in India during the festive season, putting pressure on the railway network. But how has China managed its lunar holiday travellers, which is much higher than India's? This is the bigger story behind people stuffed in train toilets in India.

Avoiding flower-pot roles: Samantha on fair representation of women in filmsActor Samantha was present at Business Today's Most Powerful Women in Business 2024 event, where she spoke about making conscious efforts to choose roles that give a fair representation of women in society. She referred to her series, Citadel: Honey Bunny, and talked about working in an action genre which is largely male-dominated.

India is not a 'dharmshala' where anyone can come and settle, says Shivraj ChouhanAddressing an election rally in Jharkhand's Ranchi, Union Agriculture Minister Shivraj Singh Chouhan said that "state-sponsored infiltration" was a serious threat to Jharkhand.

SpaceX Dragon spacecraft pushes Space Station above EarthThis demonstration is part of Nasas broader plan to increase the flexibility of ISS operations as the station moves toward its planned deorbiting in 2031.

US judge pauses 2020 election subversion case against Donald TrumpUS District Judge Tanya Chutkan in Washington approved a request from Special Counsel Jack Smith, who is prosecuting the criminal case, to set aside the deadlines, according to a court order, while they weigh its future.

Good Doctor to Extraordinary Attorney Woo: How K-dramas portray autism rightSouth Korean dramas have mastered the art of setting high standards, whether it's showcasing ideal male leads or addressing mental health with sensitivity and depth. Over the years, these dramas have evolved, offering increasingly nuanced portrayals of complex and sensitive topics, like autism. Let's take a closer look at how they've achieved this and why they resonate so deeply with audiences worldwide.
A Maruti car finally has 5 star safety ratingThe new Dzire is the maiden model from Maruti Suzuki to have garnered a five-star Global NCAP safety rating.

US tells Qatar to expel Hamas leaders after ceasefire talks fail: ReportQatar has played a major role in rounds of so-far fruitless talks to broker a ceasefire to the year-long war in Gaza. The latest round of talks in mid-October failed to produce a deal, with Hamas rejecting a short-term ceasefire proposal.

FIH Awards: Harmanpreet Singh wins Player Of The Year, Sreejesh best goalkeeperIndia's Harmanpreet Singh was adjudged as the FIH Player Of The Year, while PR Sreejeshn took home the Goalkeeper Of The Year award in the men's category on November 8, Friday. Both men played a crucial role in India's bronze medal win at Paris Olympics.

Hansal Mehta addresses criticism of The Buckingham Murders Hindi dubHansal Mehta addressed criticism over the Hindi dubbed version of his film, The Buckingham Murders, starring Kareena Kapoor Khan. The filmmaker responded to an X user about the same and clarified the situation.

Turkey film festival cancelled over ban on Daniel Craig's gay film QueerMubi Fest Istanbul was cancelled as a protest against the local authority's ban on the film Queer, starring Daniel Craig, citing it as provocative content.

Grammy nominations 2025: Beyonce leads with 11 nods for Cowboy CarterSinger Beyonce dominated the 2025 Grammy nominations with 11 nods for her country album Cowboy Carter. Taylor Swift and Billie Eilish will also compete for top prizes.

Pics: Glamorous Bollywood Wives, and Shalini Passi, at Women in Business AwardsThe cast of Fabulous Life Vs Bollywood Wives - Shalini Passi, Neelam Kothari, Maheep Kapoor, Seema Sajdeh, and Bhavana Pandey - were a part of Business Today's Women in Business Awards, where they spoke about the Netflix show, their glamorous lives and their entrepreneurial journey.

sports.headline: Sanju Samson 2024. Rohit Sharma 2013: Has Suryakumar Yadav done an MS Dhoni?South Africa vs India: With role clarity and renewed confidence, Sanju Samson seems to be making the most of his chances in T20Is. On Friday, he became the first Indian batter to hit hundreds in back-to-back T20 internationals.

Ready to make full utilisation of my form: Samson after Durban 100Sanju Samson's explosive back-to-back T20I hundreds underscore his red-hot form, setting him up as a reliable asset for India's top order after years of missed chances. His consistency is establishing him as a vital player in the lineup.

WI vs ENG: Pooran, Russell, Hetmyer back in West Indies squad for 1st 2 T20IsWest Indies have announced their squad for the first two T20Is against England, marking the return of Nicholas Pooran, Andre Russell, and Shimron Hetmyer. The series is set to begin on November 9th at Kensington Oval, Barbados.

Riccardo Calafiori and Gabbia out of Italy's squad due to injuryNations League: Riccardo Calafiori and Matteo Gabbia have been left out of Italy's squad for this month's matches with Belgium and France through injury.

Bishnoi-Varun vs South Africa looked like men against boys: BoucherSouth Africa vs India: Former cricketer Mark Boucher lauded India's spin duo Ravi Bishnoi and Varun Chakravarthy for their superb spells in Durban. Boucher said that the spinners made the match look like men vs boys.

Sanju Samson 2.0: India batter reveals roles of Gambhir, Suryakumar in revivalSanju Samson has revealed the roles played by Gautam Gambhir and Suryakumar Yadav in his revival as a T20I batter. Samson scored his second consecutive T20I hundred in the first match of the series against South Africa.

AUS A vs IND A: Dhruv Jurel hits 2nd gritty fifty, puts hand up for Perth TestDhruv Jurel made a strong case to be part of the upcoming Perth Test as he scored a second consecutive fifty in the unofficial Test against Australia-A on Saturday, November 9. Jurel once again came to India-A's rescue in Melbourne.

FIH Awards: Harmanpreet Singh wins Player Of The Year, Sreejesh best goalkeeperIndia's Harmanpreet Singh was adjudged as the FIH Player Of The Year, while PR Sreejeshn took home the Goalkeeper Of The Year award in the men's category on November 8, Friday. Both men played a crucial role in India's bronze medal win at Paris Olympics.

Boucher highlights Miller's struggle vs spin: Could not pick a thing at allMark Boucher emphasized South Africa's struggles against spin as India's Ravi Bishnoi and Varun Chakravarthy exploited Kingsmead conditions expertly, leading to a decisive 61-run victory in the T20I series opener in Durban on November 8.

If we can score 200 in 17 overs, then why not? Surya backs batting intentSA vs IND: India skipper Suryakumar Yadav backed the team's aggressive intent with the bat despite a batting collapse late in the 1st innings. Surya said that if the team can score 200 in 17 overs, then why wait till the end?

Rohit Sharma set to travel to Australia, but Perth Test participation uncertain: SourcesIndia captain Rohit Sharma is set to travel to Australia with the team. Sharma, who is expecting a child with wife Ritika might miss the first Test match in Perth vs Australia.

The Suryakumar Yadav-led team won the first T20I by 61 runs to take 1-0 lead in the series.

Team India, fans show spirit after national anthem stops in Durban SA vs IND, 1st T20I: The Indian players and the fans showed a lot of heart after the national anthem went off before the first T20I on Friday at the Kingsmead in Durban.

Boucher hails 'special' Sanju Samson: This is what he needsFormer South Africa cricketer and coach Mark Boucher had the brilliant innings from Sanju Samson. Boucher hoped that Samson gets confidence from his century and goes on to have a long career for India.

Afghanistan vs Bangladesh, 2nd ODI: When and where to watch live?AFG vs BAN: Hashmatullah Shahidi's Afghanistan and Najmul Hossain Shanto's Bangladesh will face off in the second ODI on Saturday at the Sharjah Cricket Stadium.

BCCI conducts 6-hour review meeting with Gambhir, Rohit after NZ whitewashThe BCCI has conducted an exhaustive review of India's shock 0-3 debacle against New Zealand. Skipper Rohit Sharma, chairman of selectors Ajit Agarkar, and head coach Gambhir were in attendance along with BCCI secretary Jay Shah.

Stat Pack: Sanju Samson breaks Rohit Sharma's record in Durban blitz SA vs IND, 1st T20I: Sanju Samson scored his second T20I hundred, scoring 107 runs off 50 balls with seven fours and 10 sixes against South Africa at the Kingsmead in Durban. Earlier, he also made a century against Bangladesh in Hyderabad.

Redemption like Rohit: Fans praise Samson after Durban T20I hundredSanju Samson's record-breaking century in Durban was a game-changer, making him the first Indian wicketkeeper to score back-to-back T20I hundreds, solidifying his place as a crucial player in India's T20I future.

Deccan to Durban: Sanju Samson becomes 1st Indian to hit back-to-back T20I tonsSouth Africa vs India, 1st T20I: Sanju Samson continued from where he left in Hyderabad as he began the T20I series in South Africa with a 47-ball hundred in Durban on November 8. Samson became only the fourth Indian to hit multiple hundreds in T20I cricket.

BCCI conducts 6-hour review meeting with Gambhir, Rohit after NZ whitewashThe BCCI has conducted an exhaustive review of India's shock 0-3 debacle against New Zealand. Skipper Rohit Sharma, chairman of selectors Ajit Agarkar, and head coach Gambhir were in attendance along with BCCI secretary Jay Shah.

Earlier, he also made a century against Bangladesh in Hyderabad.

Samson became only the fourth Indian to hit multiple hundreds in T20I cricket.

Sanju Samson faster than MS Dhoni to score 7000 runs in T20sSA vs IND, 1st T20I: Sanju Samson became the joint seventh-fastest Indian batter to reach the landmark of 7000 runs in T20s. He got to the landmark in the opening T20I against South Africa at the Kingsmead in Durban.

Abhishek Sharma like Sehwag, can't expect too much consistency from him: UthappaSouth Africa vs India: Former India batter Robin Uthappa said Abhishek Sharma deserves to be given a free hand to play his natural game and the team management should not expect 'too much consistency' from the aggressive opener. Abhishek was dismissed for 7 in the powerplay in the first T20I in Durban.

India players thinking of IPL auction in South Africa? Suryakumar answersSuryakumar Yadav acknowledged that IPL 2025 auction thoughts exist, but emphasized that India's focus remains on their crucial T20I series against South Africa, where breakout stars will also aim to showcase their international potential.

No debutants as Axar Patel returns for Durban T20I vs South Africa SA vs IND: Axar Patel has returned to playing for India in the opening T20I against South Africa at the Kingsmead in Durban. Axar hasn't played T20Is since the series in Sri Lanka earlier this year.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
Jawaharlal Nehru University: Brains trustTeaching and research go hand in hand at the institute which is proud of its activist tradition.
